title: Repeating Patterns
description: Identify and continue simple repeating patterns
objectives: Continue a pattern that has been started
Create simple AB, ABB, and ABC patterns

sections.title: Patterns Are Everywhere!
sections.content:
Look around you -- patterns are everywhere! Stripes on a shirt, tiles on a floor, and even the days of the week follow a pattern.

A **pattern** is something that **repeats** in a predictable way. Once you spot the pattern, you can figure out what comes next. Let's explore some fun repeating patterns!

sections.title: What Is a Repeating Pattern?
sections.content:
A **repeating pattern** has a group of things (called the **core**) that repeat over and over again.

Here are three types of patterns:

**AB Pattern** -- Two things take turns:
- red, blue, red, blue, red, blue ...
- clap, stomp, clap, stomp, clap, stomp ...

**ABB Pattern** -- One thing, then another thing twice:
- circle, square, square, circle, square, square ...
- hop, jump, jump, hop, jump, jump ...

**ABC Pattern** -- Three different things take turns:
- red, yellow, blue, red, yellow, blue ...
- big, medium, small, big, medium, small ...

The **core** is the part that repeats. In an AB pattern, the core is just two items (A and B).

sections.title: Example: Colour AB Pattern
sections.content:
Look at this pattern of coloured beads:

**red, blue, red, blue, red, blue, ?**

What comes next?

1. Find the **core** (the part that repeats): **red, blue**
2. The pattern goes: red, blue | red, blue | red, blue | ...
3. After blue comes **red** again!

The next bead is **red**.

This is an **AB pattern** because two colours take turns.

sections.title: Example: Shape ABB Pattern
sections.content:
Look at this pattern of shapes:

**circle, star, star, circle, star, star, circle, ?, ?**

What comes next?

1. Find the **core**: **circle, star, star**
2. The pattern goes: circle, star, star | circle, star, star | circle, ?, ?
3. After circle comes **star, star**!

The next two shapes are **star, star**.

This is an **ABB pattern** because the second item (star) appears twice each time.

sections.title: Example: ABC Pattern
sections.content:
Look at this pattern:

**triangle, square, circle, triangle, square, circle, triangle, ?, ?**

What comes next?

1. Find the **core**: **triangle, square, circle**
2. The pattern goes: triangle, square, circle | triangle, square, circle | triangle, ?, ?
3. After triangle comes **square**, then **circle**!

The next two shapes are **square, circle**.

This is an **ABC pattern** because three different shapes take turns.

sections.title: Finding the Core
sections.content:
To work with patterns, always look for the **core** -- the smallest group that repeats.

**Steps to find the core:**
1. Look at the first few items
2. Find where the sequence starts to **repeat**
3. The items before the repeat begins are the **core**

Once you know the core, you can:
- **Continue** the pattern (tell what comes next)
- **Fix** a pattern (find a missing piece)
- **Create** your own patterns!

sections.title: What We Learned
sections.content:
Wonderful! In this lesson you learned:

- A **repeating pattern** has a group (core) that repeats over and over
- **AB patterns**: two items take turns (red, blue, red, blue...)
- **ABB patterns**: one item then another twice (hop, jump, jump...)
- **ABC patterns**: three items take turns (red, yellow, blue...)
- How to find the **core** and continue a pattern

Look for patterns in your everyday life -- clothes, music, nature, and games!

workedExamples.title: Continuing a Colour Pattern
workedExamples.problem: What are the next 3 items in this pattern? green, yellow, green, yellow, green, yellow, ?, ?, ?
steps: Look at the pattern: green, yellow, green, yellow, green, yellow
Find the core: green, yellow (it's an AB pattern)
Continue the pattern: green, yellow, green
The next 3 items follow the core repeating
workedExamples.solution: The next 3 items are **green, yellow, green**.
workedExamples.explanation: This is an AB pattern with the core 'green, yellow'. The pattern just keeps repeating this core over and over.

workedExamples.title: Identifying a Pattern Type
workedExamples.problem: What type of pattern is this? star, heart, heart, star, heart, heart, star, heart, heart
steps: Look at the items: star, heart, heart, star, heart, heart, star, heart, heart
Find the repeating core: star, heart, heart
Count the items in the core: 3 items
Check the structure: A (star), B (heart), B (heart)
workedExamples.explanation: The core is 'star, heart, heart' where the star appears once (A) and the heart appears twice (B, B). This makes it an ABB pattern.
